prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to -90.0, 0.0, and -90.0 degrees, and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Draw the first face of the prism's 2D sketch. Start by creating two parallel lines, line\\_1 from [0.0, 0.0] to [0.025, 0.0] and line\\_4 from [0.0, 0.025] to [0.025, 0.025]. Then, create two additional lines, line\\_2 from [0.025, 0.0] to [0.025, 0.025] and line\\_3 from [0.025, 0.025] to [0.0, 0.025]. This creates a closed loop with four lines. Draw the second face of the 2D sketch. In the same face, create another loop consisting of four lines. Start by creating line\\_1' from [0.0015, 0.0015] to [0.0235, 0.0015], line\\_2' from [0.0235, 0.0015] to [0.0235, 0.0235], line\\_3' from [0.0235, 0.0235] to [0.0015, 0.0235], and line\\_4' from [0.0015, 0.0235] to [0.0015, 0.0015]. This also creates a closed loop with four lines. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.025 using the sketch\\_scale parameter. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined by the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch using the specified extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal (0.75) and extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal (0.0) settings to generate the 3D model. Use the sketch\\_scale (0.025) when extruding and apply a new body operation. The resulting intermediate CAD part has the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.025 * Height: 0.025 The part is a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.</description>
